themes.label: Laws and Regulations
themes.rationale: The text explicitly identifies itself as a chapter of ancestral law (kephalaion nomou patriou).
themes.quote: κεφ λαιον ν μου πατρ ου

themes.label: Sacred Laws and Rules
themes.rationale: The inscription prescribes specific religious duties, including sacrifices, incense offerings, and the conduct of processions and festivals.
themes.quote: τ ν πρ τανιν α θειν π ρ π τ ν βωμ ν π ντων κα πιθυμι ν τ ν λιβανωτ ν

themes.label: Hymns and Sacred Poetry
themes.rationale: The law mandates the singing of paeans (hymns) during sacrifices, processions, and all-night festivals.
themes.quote: το ς παι νας δειν ν τα ς θυσ αις κα ν τα ς πο[μ]πα ς κα ν τα ς παννυχ σιν

themes.label: Accounts and Financial Records
themes.rationale: The text mentions financial obligations and fines measured in daric staters for the maintenance of the Prytaneion and the temple of Demeter.
themes.quote: ε ς πισκευ ν το πρυτανε ου στατ ρας δαρικο ς

themes.label: Prayers and Invocations
themes.rationale: The inscription requires prayers to be made on behalf of the Roman Senate, the Roman people, and the Ephesian people.
themes.quote: ε χεσθαι π ρ ερ ς συνκλ του κα το δ μου το ωμα ων κα το δ μου το φεσ ων

persons.name: Hierophant
persons.role: Religious official who reveals sacred mysteries

persons.name: Hebdomokouretis
persons.role: Member of the college of Kouretes

rationale: This inscription from Ephesus preserves a section of ancestral law concerning the religious duties of the Prytanis. It outlines the requirements for sacrifices (incense and animal victims), the participation of various cult officials like the Hierophant and Kouretes, and the performance of paeans. It also includes a political dimension, mandating prayers for the Roman Senate and the people of Ephesus, and establishes financial regulations for the upkeep of the Prytaneion and the temple of Demeter Karpophoros.
